definition: abbr. for 論語|论语[Lun2 yu3], The Analects (of Confucius)
opinion/view/theory/doctrine/to discuss/to talk about/to regard/to consider/per/by the (kilometer, hour etc)
to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody

sentences.english: What this sort of near-propaganda obscures, though, is the real benefits of open source software.
sentences.chinese: 这类近似布道的论调遮盖了开源软件的真正好处。

sentences.english: If James Fenimore Cooper were here today he would surely have to change his tune.
sentences.chinese: 如果今天柯柏还在世的话，他就得改变他的论调了。

sentences.english: You and the "nuked Japan" obsession again.
sentences.chinese: 你和痴迷“核平日本”的论调又来了。

sentences.english: Marx was opposed to all claims of nationalism and chauvinism.
sentences.chinese: 马克思反对一切民族主义和沙文主义的论调。

sentences.english: Of course, there's an argument for diplomatic brinkmanship.
sentences.chinese: 当然，有一种外交边缘政策的论调。

sentences.english: Cameron strikes a Churchillian tone when he talks about the nation’s austerity plans.
sentences.chinese: 卡梅伦在谈到国家的紧缩计划时用的是丘吉尔的论调。

sentences.english: He argues that the Tories will always be seen as the party of privilege.
sentences.chinese: 他的论调是，保守党总是被看作特权阶级的党派。

sentences.english: Western leftists were enamored with its Marxist anti-Americanism.
sentences.chinese: 西方的左派被书中马克思主义的反美论调所倾倒。

sentences.english: This is the same argument you tend to hear for learning Latin.
sentences.chinese: 这和常听到的学习拉丁语的论调很类似。

sentences.english: This is a fairly fallacious argument.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个相当靠不住的论调。

sentences.english: Such a talk created quite a stir.
sentences.chinese: 诸如此类的论调喧嚣一时。

sentences.english: The heresy of this made Cascarellian's devoted stomach turn.
sentences.chinese: 这邪恶的论调让老卡斯卡利安感觉一阵阵胃部痉挛。

sentences.english: By the end of 2006, Hoder had changed the tone of his writing substantially.
sentences.chinese: 到2006年底，霍德很大地改变了他的论调。

sentences.english: There are so many fallacies in this view that they cannot all be disentangled at once.
sentences.chinese: 这种论调中存在好些谬误，很难一下子梳理清楚。

sentences.english: The rhetoric is getting more vituperative.
sentences.chinese: 这种论调正变得越来越强硬。

sentences.english: But this argument has cause and effect backward.
sentences.chinese: 但是，正是这种论调影响和造成了倒退。

definition: strange tales and absurd arguments (idiom)/unreasonable remarks
to snort disdainfully/to scoff at/to turn up one's nose
wording (of a proposal)/formulation/viewpoint (on an issue)/(one of eight methods of bonesetting in TCM) restoring the part displaced by a fracture to its correct position by lifting

pinyin: she4 hui4 Da2 er3 wen2 zhu3 yi4
